intro: Eriogonum lagunense, commonly known as the saltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in saline and alkaline environments. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and desert regions where it thrives in harsh, arid conditions. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it an important component of stabilizing soils in these ecosystems. Eriogonum lagunense plays a vital role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds, by providing food and habitat.
